value.title: Start Learning T-SQL for Azure Database and Azure Synapse
value.excerpt: Starting your journey to learn SQL? Adam gives you some resources to quickly ramp up with T-SQL for Azure SQL Database and Azure Synapse Analytics!  SQL Standard https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SQL#Standardization_history/  Procedure Extensions - Different SQL bases out there https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SQL#Procedural_extensions

value.title: STOP refreshing a single table at a time! (Power BI Desktop)
value.excerpt: Stop refreshing one table at a time! Also, don't wait for the entire data model to finish refreshing. Refresh multiple tables within Power BI Desktop. value.title: The Case of the Scribble Line Chart in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at a funky line chart and how it got to be that way. This is a live tile within a Power BI Dashboard based on a streaming dataset. Microsoft Flow is pushing data from Twitter into the Power BI Streaming Dataset.  Brian Gregor brought this to Adam's attention and helped setup

value.title: The Conceptual Data Model and Limits
value.excerpt: A look at the data model from a file perspective.  The Excel Workbook or PBIX file is not the data model, but just a container that the Model is inside of.  I also revisit limits on the size.  http://blogs.technet.com/b/powerbisupport/archive/2015/08/11/the-conceptual-data-model-and-limits.aspx  SUBSCRIBE!

value.title: The Tale of Two Caches
value.excerpt: Want to optimize performance in Power BI? Of course, you do! In order to do that, you need to understand the two caches that are at play and how they affect your optimization efforts. value.title: Using Azure SQL Database Failover with Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how you can easily use Azure SQL Database Failover Groups with Power BI to ensure you have access to your data. Connecting to an Azure SQL Database Failover Group from Power BI is easier than connecting to a secondary replica of an Always On Availability Group.  LET'S

value.title: Using different languages with the Power BI site
value.excerpt: I look at how your browser languages affect what is displayed. This all comes down to your browsers and the language settings within. Different browsers are configured differently. value.title: Using Precedence to force Power BI Aggregations
value.excerpt: Are your Power BI Aggregations not matching? Setting Precedence can control which Power BI aggregation will be preferred. A little hint to help it on its way!
